name: jira_bulk_update_issues
description: Update multiple Jira issues in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling jira_update_issue multiple times. Pass issue keys as a comma-separated string.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: New priority for all issues: 'Highest', 'High', 'Medium', 'Low', 'Lowest' (leave empty to skip)

parameters.name: summary_prefix
parameters.description: Prefix to add to each issue's summary (leave empty to skip)

steps.code: const baseUrl = `{{jira_url}}`.replace(/\/$/, ''); return `{{issue_keys}}`.split(',').map(k => ({ url: baseUrl + '/browse/' + k.trim(), key: k.trim() }))
steps.name: items
steps.label: Build issue URL list

detailSteps.code: const baseUrl = `{{jira_url}}`.replace(/\/$/, ''); const key = window.location.pathname.split('/').pop(); const fields = {}; const priority = `{{priority}}`; if (priority) fields.priority = { name: priority }; const prefix = `{{summary_prefix}}`; if (prefix) { const gResp = await fetch(baseUrl + '/rest/api/3/issue/' + key + '?fields=summary', { credentials: 'same-origin' }); if (gResp.ok) { const d = await gResp.json(); fields.summary = prefix + d.fields.summary; } } if (Object.keys(fields).length === 0) return { status: 'skipped', key: key, message: 'No fields to update' }; const resp = await fetch(baseUrl + '/rest/api/3/issue/' + key, { method: 'PUT', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, credentials: 'same-origin', body: JSON.stringify({ fields }) }); if (!resp.ok) return { status: 'error', key: key, error: resp.status }; return { status: 'updated', key: key, updated_fields: Object.keys(fields) }
detailSteps.name: update_result
detailSteps.label: Update issue
